# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = [""] # start with an empty line
    for word in split(text)
        if length(join(lines, "")) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, "") # add a new line if needed
        end
        append!(lines[end], word) # append the word to the last line
    end
    return join(lines, "\n") # join all lines with newline characters
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello world! This is a very long string that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line.")
"Hello world!\nThis is a very long\nstring that should be\nwrapped at 10 characters per line."
```
